channel.title: Dying! oh noses
channel.description: well i have noticed that all of the forums boards are dying :o today the i checked the general discussion board and read the threads, came back 3 hours later and no new posts/replys and the same is with all the boards. what can mopar do to fix it?

item.title: Dying! oh noses
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“fluffymuff1n, post:43, topic:177883”][quote author=ThugLife link=topic=238832.msg2048846#msg2048846 date=1202827380]

Rune Locus (who went through several names and many forums and websites before getting where they are today.) This proves persistence is key.

Their members constantly spamming moparisthebest.com with links to runelocus.com have anything to do with it?
They join the community because they think everyone will do it for them.
[/quote][/quote]

Could you rephrase that??

[quote=“ThugLife, post:42, topic:177883”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=238832.msg2048635#msg2048635 date=1202806885]
Rune Locus (who went through several names and many forums and websites before getting where they are today.) This proves persistence is key.
[/quote]
Their members constantly spamming moparisthebest.com with links to runelocus.com have anything to do with it?[/quote]

item.title: Dying! oh noses
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Not entirely true. Forums that are based off of MoparScape.org are the ones that fail (even if they do not pertain to runescape at all, the owner still started here.) The only forums I saw that lasted were FrugooScape (who went through only a few forums before being successful) and Rune Locus (who went through several names and many forums and websites before getting where they are today.) This proves persistence is key.

Read full topic

item.title: Dying! oh noses
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“the fu superior, post:33, topic:177883”][quote author=ThugLife link=topic=238832.msg2043875#msg2043875 date=1202649782]

But yea, generally, when an intelligent breaks out on #mopar, its killed in a matter of minutes.

I have seen you on probably 5 times maximum, how would you know? #mopar goes through different phases through the day.
[/quote]
I’ve been told countless times in the “5 times” I’ve been on that, that is what happens.
Never have i seen one intelligent convo.[/quote]

I’ve seen plenty. I often see programming discussions. Sometimes debates on any type of issue can break out as well.

Of course it can get silly in there too. But thats ok imo. It’s just a place to chat.

edit: Also I just realized how stupid I sounded in my last post

Read full topic

item.title: Dying! oh noses
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“diamond™, post:26, topic:177883”][quote author=error.login link=topic=238832.msg2039671#msg2039671 date=1202514653]

Average registrations per day: 330.96
Average posts per day: 2834.31
Average topics per day: 279.86

I would hardly say the forum is dying. To inactivity anyways.

i would say about 85-93% of that is on moparscape
[/quote]
i would say 90-93% of tht is moparscape.[/quote]
And I would say that it makes up about 91.668614712358683146686254568445346786534653686853463%.

:rolleyes:

This place is hardly on its deathbed. There has always been a substantial influx of users; check the forum statistics and see for yourself.

Read full topic

Day New Topics New Posts New Members Most Online
2008-02-02 388 2550 550 373

Still doesn’t seem like ‘dying’ to me, we are in full school-season swing…

edit: The daily statistics are actually more than the averages, which means if anything the forum is growing[/quote]
